Criticizing China's actions (G) and military posturing (H) show strength without inciting immediate conflict. Using surveillance drones (I), increasing cyber capacities (J), and trade agreements (D, M) are moderate approaches that may not escalate tensions directly. Actions like international arbitration (E), and cybersecurity attacks (O) can seem less potent or indirect, while targeted attacks (P) and cutting diplomatic relationships (L) may lead to direct confrontation. Full-on invasion (Q), tactical nuclear strikes (R), and full nuclear attacks (S) are the most extreme and least reasonable, potentially leading to large-scale war.
